$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have a heart murmur.$!

##Car or motorcycle licence

You don't need to tell DVLA. You should stop driving for at least 1 month and only start driving again when you doctor tells you that you are safe to do so. For further information please download the leaflet 'CLE1066'.

$D
[Download 'CLE1066 - Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions' (PDF, 176K)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_192828.pdf "Download leaflet 'CLE1066: Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions' (PDF, 176K)"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form. 

$D [Download 'VOCH1 - Confidential medical information questionnaire' (PDF, 394KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065302.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you have a heart murmur - download the correct form if you need to let them know
title: Heart murmurs and driving
